Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I implemented the stubs for chains that implement selfimporting (for lack of better terminology). for now there is no validation when the -ac_import=PUBKEY option is used. Once the normal crosschain tx creations are verified to work, then I will add the validation for this mode. What it will rely on is that the -ac_pubkey=pubkey has signed the vin0 for the burnTx. This then allows any type of centralized coin creation, ie. via website, via oracles data of any interpretation, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: jl777 branch

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the -ac_import=PUBKEY is literal, so that string exactly is needed to enable this mode

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i also added stubs for GATEWAY, which will allow 1:1 sidechains to be created

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I need a stable daemon we can use the launch the main chain. It seems I have one last "lock up" bug left to find, and I'm not looking forward to it at all as I have no idea what does it or where it could even be. 😦

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Even though we no longer need it, I have merged the fix for ac_split into our supernet fork.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It seems after restarting everything I have not encountered the daemon lock up bug again. Please be on the look out for this, and let me know. @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢  I think it was only me and you that its happened to. It was on a daemon that was PoW mining, but has never happened to a staking node.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: going to have another look at that peers thing.... I have a feeling simply removing the fixed peers from our daemon will help... But genie's idea of simply removing a node from the peers list after it does not respond could also work.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Found a much cleaner way to disable DNS seeds, but I am really not convinced thats the problem tbh.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If you clear peers.dat and then let it run. after a long enough time all these IP's end up back in your peers list, and the node just tries to connect to them. Seems to be a low level BTC network thing, not sure its worth me wastign time on. If i'm going to so anything with networking code., I should be trying to disable the mempool on InistalBlockDownload, maybe i will find the answer to this other problem of trying to connect to dead nodes constantly, by accident later on 😃

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
the condition that allows coins to be created from the mempool fix, if indeed it can happen is:
1) tx invalid (no or wrong vins) included in block that is not in any other nodes mempool
2) that block is mined and broadcast
3) then other nodes add the tx to their mempool and verify another valid tx against it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: very improbable but with enough dice txs and miners

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it should just happen

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: wait, how can coins be created from the mempool fix??

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which "fix"

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it would require a very special and al;m,ost impossible chain of events...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but I think if a tx can be created spending a tx included in a block by a maliciouls miner it might happen

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: unless I am not understanding everything.... but ive been thinking about this for many days since I made it trying to figure out how it could happen

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a tx without vins wont have any valid outputs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so any funds spent would be an invalid tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: they can be put into the mempool though if they are included in a received block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a received block, or validated block?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: to make it fast, it had tro not check vins only under that exact condition.... when already in a block no inputs checks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that adds them oput of order

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: bu8t then after that the block processes as normal

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and any txs withj no vins are rejected

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but for a silght moment they are int he mempool of a node

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, but in the mempool doesnt mean it will validate in a block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes but cannot a cc tx be created from the mempool and for a shor time it would be valid

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: because vin checks only go back 1 tx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well, it might appear valid and get into the mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but then when it is fully validated in a block it should be rejected as invalid tx

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and then the block with invalid tx is an invalid block

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I mean this is almost impossibly improbable what im saying

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it requres multiple blocks to be mined in less than maybe 100ms

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but even if it does, the full block validation would reject an illegal tx in the mempool
